    • Method Detail

      • getWords

        public java.lang.String[] getWords(java.lang.String parseString)
        Retrieves a string array of words from a string. The words are are separated by delimiters. This does not make use of the BreakIterator class since in this class the delimiters can not be set explicitly (as far as I know).
        Parameters:
        parseString - the sentence to be parsed
        Returns:
        a list with all words found

      • setDelimiters

        public void setDelimiters(java.lang.String delimiters)
        Sets the delimiters that are being used by getWords(). The delimiters are concatenated in a string. The default is ";, ".
        Parameters:
        delimiters - the delimiters

      • isDelimiter

        protected boolean isDelimiter(char search)

      • quoteString

        public java.lang.String quoteString(java.lang.String value)
        Quotes a string with single quotes. This is useful for quoting strings in SQL queries. Null values are printed as null which should work with SQL as well. Single quotes in the input string are also quoted such that they are preserved across an SQL query.
        Parameters:
        value - the value string to be quoted
        Returns:
        the quoted string.

      • csvWrite

        public java.lang.String csvWrite(java.lang.String value)

      • setCsvDelimiterChar

        public void setCsvDelimiterChar(java.lang.Character theDelimiter)

      • encryptPassword

        public java.lang.String encryptPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Encrypts an input password into a new string using the SHA algorithm. The encrypted password is returned as string in hexadecimal notation with hyphens in between (e.g. '-45-58-8050-1e5a36-1954-27-2459-6dd104c-68-24521d')
        Parameters:
        password - the password to be encrypted
        Returns:
        the encrypted password.

      • dateTimeWriter

        public java.lang.String dateTimeWriter()
        Returns a string with the current date and time in ISO format yyyy-MM-dd H:mm:ss.S. Can usually directly be used to write a Timestamp in an SQL query.
        Returns:
        the current date and time in ISO format.

      • setURIs

        public void setURIs(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
